diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Tumor-induced osteomalacia due to metastatic ameloblastic fibrosarcoma
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: FGF23-dependent hypophosphatemia, renal Fanconi syndrome, primary hyperparathyroidism, renal tubular acidosis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's recurrent hypophosphatemia and associated bone pain suggest a disorder affecting bone mineralization, specifically osteomalacia. Laboratory tests showed significantly low serum phosphorus and normal parathyroid hormone levels, indicating renal phosphate wasting rather than malnutrition. The patient had a history of a jaw tumor, suggesting a potential FGF23-producing tumor. Imaging and elevated FGF23 levels confirmed tumor-induced osteomalacia due to an underlying malignant neoplasm.
